body:
During some 'chaos' testing I noticed that if all Nodes are taken offline (NotReady status) then Pods freeze in the "Running" state indefinitely (well, at least over an hour at the time of writing) as you can see below.

The controller logs spam out "Evicting pods2" (see below) but no action is taken. Pod fail-over was working while taking one node down at a time, so it would suggest the issue occurs only when no nodes are available.

The cluster was provisioned on my local machine inside VirtualBox VMs as per the manual Fedora docs (with flannel), using the latest release in the Fedora repo.

```
[root@kube-master01 ~]# kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"0", Minor:"16+", GitVersion:"v0.16.2-659-g63182318c5876b", GitCommit:"63182318c5876b94ac9b264d1224813b2b2ab541", GitTreeState:"clean"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"0", Minor:"16+", GitVersion:"v0.16.2-659-g63182318c5876b", GitCommit:"63182318c5876b94ac9b264d1224813b2b2ab541", GitTreeState:"clean"}
```

```
[root@kube-master01 ~]# kubectl get nodes
NAME          LABELS                   STATUS
kube-node01   name=kube-node01-label   NotReady
kube-node02   name=kube-node02-label   NotReady

[root@kube-master01 ~]# kubectl get pods
POD                  IP           CONTAINER(S)   IMAGE(S)   HOST           LABELS              STATUS    CREATED         MESSAGE
redis-master-knlqv   18.16.34.2                             kube-node02/   name=redis-master   Running   About an hour   
                                  master         redis                                         Running   About an hour   
```

This may be useful:

```
[root@kube-master01 ~]# kubectl get pods -o json
{
    "kind": "List",
    "apiVersion": "v1beta3",
    "metadata": {},
    "items": [
        {
            "kind": "Pod",
            "apiVersion": "v1beta3",
            "metadata": {
                "name": "redis-master-knlqv",
                "generateName": "redis-master-",
                "namespace": "default",
                "selfLink": "/api/v1beta3/namespaces/default/pods/redis-master-knlqv",
                "uid": "bc80b48b-fbf7-11e4-adb8-08002774923b",
                "resourceVersion": "3961",
                "creationTimestamp": "2015-05-16T18:16:56Z",
                "labels": {
                    "name": "redis-master"
                },
                "annotations": {
                    "kubernetes.io/created-by": "{\"kind\":\"SerializedReference\",\"apiVersion\":\"v1beta3\",\"reference\":{\"kind\":\"ReplicationController\",\"namespace\":\"default\",\"name\":\"redis-master\",\"uid\":\"20297383-fbf6-11e4-adb8-08002774923b\",\"apiVersion\":\"v1beta3\",\"resourceVersion\":\"3815\"}}"
                }
            },
            "spec": {
                "volumes": null,
                "containers": [
                    {
                        "name": "master",
                        "image": "redis",
                        "ports": [
                            {
                                "containerPort": 6379,
                                "protocol": "TCP"
                            }
                        ],
                        "resources": {},
                        "terminationMessagePath": "/dev/termination-log",
                        "imagePullPolicy": "IfNotPresent",
                        "capabilities": {},
                        "securityContext": {
                            "capabilities": {},
                            "privileged": false
                        }
                    }
                ],
                "restartPolicy": "Always",
                "dnsPolicy": "ClusterFirst",
                "host": "kube-node02"
            },
            "status": {
                "phase": "Running",
                "Condition": [
                    {
                        "type": "Ready",
                        "status": "True"
                    }
                ],
                "podIP": "18.16.34.2",
                "containerStatuses": [
                    {
                        "name": "master",
                        "state": {
                            "running": {
                                "startedAt": "2015-05-16T18:16:59Z"
                            }
                        },
                        "lastState": {},
                        "ready": true,
                        "restartCount": 0,
                        "image": "redis",
                        "imageID": "docker://95af5842ddb9b03f7c6ec7601e65924cec516fcedd7e590ae31660057085cf67",
                        "containerID": "docker://865e4e5f4f0101ff9a0e0b7924b7a76167ac5daebf96ffa225b495f28363155a"
                    }
                ]
            }
        }
    ]
}
```

And this:

[root@kube-master01 ~]# journalctl -r -u kube-
kube-apiserver.service           kube-controller-manager.service  kube-scheduler.service

labels.description: Highest priority. Must be actively worked on as someone's top priority right now.
labels.name: priority/critical-urgent

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG API Machinery.
labels.name: sig/api-machinery

milestone.description: Issues that need to be resolved for v1.0 of Kubernetes.
milestone.title: v1.0

title: Pod status freezes on "Running" indefinitely if all nodes are taken offline.
